boardgame.name: How many Baphomet Do You Need?
ひつじのあくま (Hitsuji no Akuma)
boardgame.description:
ひつじのあくま (Hitsuji no Akuma) is a card game from Japan. The title translates as Devil Sheep, meaning Baphomet. The game box also says "How many Baphomet Do You Need?".

In the game, players are supplying various Baphomet to meet the needs of their customers. each player gets a secret character, a customer who wants a certain number of Baphomet.
They need to provide the correct amount of Baphomet demanded to get the best score. Too many or too few, they score less or zero.

With only 5 hand cards, players must trade Baphomet without disclosing the total they really need.

On a turn, a player either places a card as part of their supply, or plays a card using the effects on the card. When placing a card, it can go face up, showing some Baphomet, or face down to be revealed at the game end.

When a card is played for its affect, this might apply to the player or to another, and moves Baphomet cards around.

There are several special action cards too, which reverse fortunes, but players could lose all their Baphomet.

When the deck is exhausted, the game ends and players turn up their cards and calculate a final score.

The publisher says that the game is more chaotic with 5 players, and more thoughtful with 2 players.

The game is listed as for age 12+, but reviewers say it is easy to play, and should really be age 8+.
user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Red I Games (レッド・アイ・ゲームズ)

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice (Fourth Edition): Earthfang Relic Die
boardgame.description: This all-new melee weapon was forged after the mighty axe "Earthfang' from Esfah lore. With SAIs like Bash, Counter, Fly, Sneak Attack, and Smite, this relic comes with great power, but must be wielded with caution...

boardgame.name: Valley of Plenty
boardgame.description:
Valley of Plenty is a campaign source book for Glorantha written for the QuestWorlds rule-system. It is completely compatible with HeroQuest: Glorantha and easily adaptable for use with RuneQuest: Glorantha. The lovingly detailed presentation of the Dundealos tribe’s culture and community is system agnostic.

Valley of Plenty is the first book of The Jaldonkillers Saga, a grand campaign that follows the careers of a band of player characters through the destruction of their tribe, its reconstitution in exile, and the effort to reclaim its lost lands and glory. The saga begins in 1602 and stretches to the Dragonrise and beyond. It is intended as a vehicle to support the development of characters from childhood to Herodom in a fluid but consistent setting, in which players can experience adventures ranging from slice-of-life challenges to world-changing conflicts.

This book details the adventures of a closely-knit clique of youngsters, the Wildlings, from their early childhood through their adulthood rites. Along the way, GMs and players learn about the culture and community that produced the Wildlings in a natural, organic progression. Neither the GM or their players are forced to drink lore from a firehose.

- Back of the book

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice (Fourth Edition): Dragonslayer Die
boardgame.description:
The Dragonslayer is a 4-health unit that is a melee machine. They are also part of the Eldarim species. A Dragonslayer can kill any color of dragon if it rolls its SFR Logo during a dragon attack. Dragonslayers can cast any color of magic (not just the colors at the current terrain). Dragonslayers can carry magical items (including medallions) of any color.

These are the champions of the Eldarim species. See the Acolytes of the Eldarim kicker for more information.

boardgame.name: Caricatoon
boardgame.description: Choose wisely the celebrity whose name you will make guess among your cards according to the challenge imposed. Attention! You only have 45 seconds to succeed! Meet the biggest stars of the world and of our country. Actors, comedians, politicians, athletes and even mystery personalities... Mime, draw, question and imitate! Laughter and fun are guaranteed.

boardgame.name: Magpie
boardgame.description:
Magpie continues the trend of Roll and Write Revolution doing out of the box ideas. In Magpie, players play as a magpie who is collecting items (Sticks, Eggs, Worms, Seeds, and Shinies). Each of the players has a hidden bonus card that will enable all players to score points for certain collections. The players will also have a plus or minus value for the Shinies, which are totaled to provide a score.

Further, the magpie players are also fighting for control of the 6 areas. They may instead of destroying the hex space to gain a resource, write in their own player symbol. The player(s) who have the most symbols in each area will score points.

Magpie forces up to four players to really gather in tight as they will all be playing off of the same sheet. Wild interactions will occur and you may wonder if your friends are bird-brains or actually clever.

Also includes a solo player variant where the player is against Martha Magpie and her love for Shinies!

Magpie plays 1-4 players in 30-60 min; Language independent components!

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Contact: Tactical Alien Defense Role-Playing Game
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Are you the type to ask too many questions? Are you infamous for being over-prepared for any situation you encounter? Do people marvel at your outside-the-box thinking and inventiveness? Could you be a scientific genius, an athlete, a mastermind of espionage? Or, do you just excel at crushing your opponents?

The year is 2047 A.D., and a clandestine agency called OMEGA has just recruited you into their ranks of international operatives: soldiers, scientists, spooks, bureaucrats and diplomats, from around the world, all of whom who have already caught a faint glimpse of the impending doom.

Technology has evolved. War has evolved. Unfortunately, trapped in the human condition, Earth's dominant species hasn't. People from all walks of life are still puzzled in the face of a threat that's overshadowed human history for millennia, eluding their grasp, and always lurking beneath layers of lies and deceit.

In this politically-charged future, you will pit your wits and resources against multiple hostile extraterrestrial factions while trying to put an end to the domestic dangers of human lunacy and corporate greed. Enter a vibrant world of UFO madness, mystery, and cutting-edge technology... if you have what it takes to be the last line of defense for your entire planet.

It is time to change the game.

Command. Research. Fight Back.

boardgame.name: The Mystery of the Lost Patrol
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Evil never rests and neither should the forces of good. It has been one year since the end of the War of the Lance, and while the forces of the Whitestone Council are still battling the remnants of the Dragon Highlord armies, a new force is arising. In the area around Throtl rumors spread of a forgotten book that can unlock a long-forgotten secret. With limited forces in the area, the Whitestone Council must look to others to help unlock the mystery and prevent an ancient legend from being unleashed on Krynn.

boardgame.name: John Carter of Mars: Character and Token Card Deck
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

John Carter of Mars is a science-fantasy roleplaying game from the mind of Edgar Rice Burroughs. It will transport you to Barsoom, an arid, dying land of ancient civilizations and fearsome creatures. Using a pulp-action inspired variant of the 2d20 System, take on the role of heroes as you travel, battle, and romance your way across the wondrous and dangerous world of Barsoom

Modiphius Entertainment presents the John Carter of Mars Character and Token Card Deck. See the famed heroes and strange creatures that inhabit the dying world. 52 character and creature art cards, 3 narrator character reference cards, all with card backs for Threat, Momentum and Luck are sure to make your John Carter of Mars campaigns come to life!

• Full colour US poker size cards
• 52 character and creature art cards
• 3 narrator reference cards for NPC characters
• Card backs which feature symbols to represent Threat, Momentum and Luck

boardgame.name: Epic Legacy Tome of Titans Vol. 1
boardgame.description:
The Ultimate Guide to Epic Foes

From the introduction:

What is a legendary hero without a worthy antagonist? Bored, that’s what. If you are like us, you’ve probably experienced games of 5th Edition in which the campaign’s villains just couldn’t live up to the hype. Perhaps their mechanics weren’t unique or scary enough to make an impression. Maybe the DM struggled to effectively integrate the foe into the story. These can be frustrating experiences for DM and player alike. The ultimate antagonists to a grand 5th Edition campaign should be figures of tremendous power, wondrous lore, and engaging mechanics. That is where this book comes in. Contained within the Epic Legacy Tome of Titans are twenty-two incredible antagonists ranging from iconic fantasy villains such as Asmodeus and the Dark Dragonqueen to completely original concepts such as Niccoli the Lich Child or Suhte the Celestial Dragon.

A titan is more than a collection of stats. Each is meticulously crafted to deliver a comprehensive campaign experience. You will find content to not just make a titan a badass on the battlefield but a truly dynamic foe that will never disappoint in every pillar of play. Whether your games are exploring the high-level realms of 5th Edition or reveling in the staggering power of our Epic Legacy system, the Tome of Titans has what you need to run your best campaign ever. The content found here will help you integrate or even structure an entire campaign around these awesome creatures.

boardgame.name: Evolving Items
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This content pack contains 30 new magic items that evolve as you grow in power. Depending on what character level you are when you attune to these items, you have access to different abilities.

These items are great as starting items, beginning the game at low power and growing more powerful as the character levels up.

boardgame.name: The Kobold Kompendium
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A barbarian runs in pursuit of a puny kobold in his escape. The wizard warns him to stop, but it’s already too late. The tunnel collapses as soon as the barbarian enters it, burying him below a pile of rock. The cleric rushes to the rescue of her friend, just to be ambushed by dozens of kobolds. The wizard begins to despair and throws a bolt of fire at the horde, igniting the gas that the little dragons prepared. A wave of fire consumes the adventurers, leaving nothing but their calcined bodies and equipment. Sure, many kobolds died while protecting their warren, but these pesky adventurers won’t bother anyone anymore and have left the surviving kobolds a fair stash of loot.

The Kobold Kompendium is a collection of everything you need to run new and fresh adventures featuring the best of Dungeons & Dragons’s minions.

boardgame.name: アニマリーナ (Animarina)
boardgame.description:
アニマリーナ (Animarina) is a tile placement game from Japan.

Players are explorers in a wild land in Africa, looking for a lost family member. They encounter various animals who offer to help, in return for being the most favoured animal in the land.

Players draw cards in their and place them across spaces on the game board, linking up with arrows on the card edges. The player's goal is to create the largest area in their own colour. By using the animals special abilities, they can gain and secure more land.

Some animals are stronger in certain habitats, such as the gorilla in the forest. Some animals gain strength from being linked in a herd.

A player can place their animal over another if their animal has a higher number. So a #4 dog can cover a #3 dog, and extend the territory.

When the game ends, the player covering the most spaces is the winner.
user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Game Creation Association ZAM (ゲーム創作結社ザム)
boardgame.boardgameartist: Kogore Bobo (こぐれ ぼぶお)

boardgame.name: Errant Lightning
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Core sector is the heart of the Third Imperium, the seat of empire and an economic powerhouse, but even the Core has its backwater worlds. One such place is Adan, a dry, almost desert world with a unique ecosphere and a secret that few know.

Adan’s small hydrosphere is entirely located in a single deep sea called the Cleft. From that sea grows the Clench, a writhing mass of plant life that extends far into the desert, providing life-giving crops for the world’s six million people. Unfortunately, the Clench is dying and the only people who can help are a remote community of psionic exiles living in the deep desert. The people of Adan have come to terms with their presence, but a scientific team from an Imperial Research Station has come to the planet to find the psions and strip them of their psionic abilities using a controversial new technique. If they succeed, all of Adan might very well pay the price.

boardgame.name: Shadow of the Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition
boardgame.description:
Shadow of the Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition includes all available content to date. Experience Shadow of the Tomb Raider featuring the final chapter of Lara Croft’s origin story, the Season Pass containing multiple challenge tombs, missions, weapons, and outfits, Croft Edition bonuses, the all-new Definitive Edition “Croft Fitness” outfit, and additional gameplay adjustments.

Source: The Publisher Website.
boardgame.videogamecompilation: Shadow of the Tomb Raider - The Forge
Shadow of the Tomb Raider - The Grand Caiman
Shadow of the Tomb Raider - The Nightmare
Shadow of the Tomb Raider - The Path Home
Shadow of the Tomb Raider - The Pillar
Shadow of the Tomb Raider - The Price of Survival
Shadow of the Tomb Raider - The Serpent's Heart

boardgame.name: Dirty Laundry: Sabotage Shedding Game
boardgame.description:
Dirty Laundry is a sabotage shedding game. Outsmart your opponents by washing your Dirty Laundry first. Pay close attention to your opponents as they might play dirty and ruin your laundry. Play strategically by concealing items, such as throwing a red sock into a load of white garments. Play dirty and break washing machines so no one can win. A game built on sabotage and fabricated on messing with your opponents. Stain in your seats, Dirty Laundry is here to ruin your relationships, you have been worn!

The objective is to wash all your dirty laundry first. Fill up the washing machine with the correct cleaning fluids and press wash. Simple!

Not so fast!

This is where Dirty Laundry gets dirty, no one knows what items you have loaded into the washing machine! Players take turns to strategically place concealed items, action cards and garments into communal washing machines. Pay close attention to your opponents as they might be out there to ruin your laundry.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Trekking the World: Trivia
boardgame.description:
Trekking the World Trivia is a family trivia game that lets players experience countries all around the world in a fun and interesting way. You don’t have to be good at trivia in order to play and love this game. Players will make their best guesses at the question to earn points. Anyone can play and win. Plus setup is easy—just open the box and start playing within minutes.

It doesn’t matter if you’re looking for a trivia game, games for teens, or family games, this one is perfect for your next family game night. The box is small (8x8), which makes it easy to take on the road or in the car.

boardgame.name: Let It Snow
boardgame.description:
A tiddly-wink based drafting/set collecting game! Accumulate Holly, Ice, Silver and Gold and even Coal! Take some fire, but too much could burn down your tree. Draft carefully and while you're at it, stick your neighbor with something they didn't want. It is Christmas after all.

—user summary

Let it Snow is a brand new, instant classic set collection game. Draft to improve your score, hurt your opponent's score or ideally both! Draw, draft and score your way to victory in this celebration of winter, snow and all things cold! And since you have no place to go, let it snow!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Loot N' Loaded
boardgame.description:
You and your fellow bounty hunters are seeking out amazing treasures and rewards, but in your heart of hearts you are competing for the ultimate prize: to become the fastest gun in the world. Are you fast enough?

In this one of a kind strategic card collecting game, you gunslingers get the most points by winning and stacking multiples of each treasure and reward.

But gaining the cards takes some strategy and skill...

—description from the back of the box

boardgame.name: Santa's Workshop
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the North Pole!

It’s late in December, and Santa is gearing up for his big night. His elvish helpers are busy making sure he's ready to deliver joy across the world! The elves have a lot to do: toys to be built and assembled, reindeer to be tended in the stables, and the North Pole's own Christmas tree to decorate. It's a time of unbelievable hustle and bustle!

After the Christmas season is over, Santa always takes his own holiday, somewhere sunny and warm, and he brings along the most industrious team of elves as a reward. Can you lead your elvish crew to earn a spot with Santa on vacation?

Santa's Workshop is a reimplementation of a game by the same name released in 2017. This new edition comes with two game modes: the standard game for families, and an advanced game for ages 10 and up.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Valeria: Card Kingdoms – New in VCK2E
Valeria: Königreich der Karten – Neu in VCK2E
boardgame.description:
Add-on available during the Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Darksworn Kickstarter campaign that included all the new cards found in the 2nd edition of Valeria: Card Kingdoms for first edition owners.

Includes:
5 Herald Starter Cards
6 Event Cards
5 Reference Cards
2 Card Dividers (Starter Herald and Monster Events_

boardgame.name: TxK
boardgame.description:
TxK is an action video game developed by Llamasoft and designed by Jeff Minter. The game was released on the PlayStation Vita on February 11, 2014. The game was planned for release on PC, PlayStation 4, and Android platforms until Atari made legal threats against Llamasoft, citing similarities between TxK and Tempest 2000.

It is a tube shooter based on the classic arcade game Tempest. The gameplay expands upon that of the original by including power-ups which grant the player additional abilities. The option is available to play without power-ups, however.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TxK TxK]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Infiltraitors
boardgame.description:
Your organisation has been infiltrated by moles - nefarious informants for the enemy. As faithful agents, you must work together to uncover and eliminate the traitors before time runs out.

This challenging deduction game uses a standard deck of cards. Nine cards are set aside at the start - these are the traitors that must be identified by suit and rank. Players must manage their hands to give and get clues about the traitor cards. Clues are other playing cards that may match a traitor by having the same suit or rank, or where the rank is either a multiple or whole factor of the traitor's. As the clues accumulate, players may deduce the identity of each traitor card, but can they do it to win before the draw pile (and time) runs out?

The players win if all 9 traitor cards are identified correctly.

boardgame.name: Mit År10: Quizzen om 10'erne
boardgame.description:
A quiz game with a stack of cards each with six questions about the 2010's.

At the beginning of the game, the players decide how many points to play to.

On a player's turn, he rolls the die and the player to his left asks him the corresponding question. If he answers correctly, he gets the card as a point. If his answer is wrong, the other players may hit the bell to answer the question and get the card and the point if correct.

The game ends when a player has the agreed number of points.

boardgame.name: Mini expansion set for Sprawlopolis, Circle the Wagons, Stew and Tussie Mussie
boardgame.description:
This set of 35 cards contains 9 different mini expansions to the first four games in our Master Print Mini series. These cards bring even more variation to Sprawlopolis and Stew and add a solo mode to Circle the Wagons and Tussie Mussie. The cards do not come in a box but in a zip-lock bag, for easy addition to your Master Print Mini games. The following expansions are included in this set:

Sprawlopolis: Beaches (4 cards)
Sprawlopolis: Construction Zones (4 cards)
Sprawlopolis: Interstate (4 cards)
Sprawlopolis: Points of Interest (1 card)
Sprawlopolis: Wrecktar (1 card)
Circle the Wagons: Lone Cowboy (6 cards)
Circle the Wagons: Lone Cowboy Rides Again (3 cards)
Stew: Fungus Among Us (6 cards)
Tussie Mussie: Flower Shoppe (6 cards)
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Circle the Wagons: Lone Cowboy Rides Again

boardgame.name: Syndicate: Add-On Pack
boardgame.description:
An add-on pack consisting of '6 New Starship Minis' (5 assault fleet and 1 smuggler ship)

From the package:

"Bring your assaults to life with five ASSAULT FLEET miniatures. Attack with one or bring in the reinforcements to ensure victory!

Everything a smuggler would want in a ship! Traverse Arcturus in style with the NGATA SMUGGLING SHIP miniature."

From the website:

"The miniature add-on pack helps bring your game to life with 6 all new DELUXE starship miniatures, including 1 Smuggler’s Vessel and 5 Advanced Assault Ships. Here’s how to use them:

Advanced Assault Ships

The advanced assault ships are used in place of the Assault Ship card board cutout to indicate an assault and track assault strength. The first Advanced Assault Ship mini in an assault represents a base assault, with each additional ship representing a reinforcement (up to 4 reinforcements, or 5 ships total)

NGATA Smuggler’s Vessel

The Smuggler’s Vessel can be used in place of the Sovereign Destroyer in the NGATA single player campaign."

Plastic bag with cardboard header, 10.5×16×1.5 cm, 30 g, contains five 7×9 cm ziplocs each containing a single (white) assault ship miniature. The Ngata (black) miniature is loose.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: SYNDICATE: An Interplanetary Conquest Board Game

boardgame.name: Boj o Velku Moravu
boardgame.description:
Boj o Velku Moravu ("The Battle for Great Moravia") is an original Slovak strategy game that will take you back to a time when there was a relentless fight between the armies of the Eastern Franks, Western Slavs and old Hungarians in our region.

Each of the players will be one of the nations and strive to occupy as much territory as possible on the playing field with the help of their military party. By occupying settlements in battles, players gain points that they can use to develop their army and settle free territory. Each nation has its own characteristics, so on the road to victory, everyone must use a slightly different strategy. The winner is the player who has the largest territory at the end of the game, but the victory can be sided with the occupation of a strategic place or the size of the army.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: 1st&Goal
boardgame.description: App version of the board game 1st & Goal.

boardgame.name: Trophy Loom
boardgame.description:
From the book:

Trophy Loom is a system-agnostic setting book for dark medieval fantasy roleplaying games, especially the games under the Trophy banner.

boardgame.name: Blätterrauschen
boardgame.description: App version of the board game Blätterrauschen.

boardgame.name: The Never Nexus
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A small adventure location for the amazing DURF by Emiel Boven.

The Never Nexus sits in a space between planes. There are many reasons people and creatures end up here: magical backfires, a visit from the Repossessors of Planar Property, answering a want add in the local Goblin paper The Goblin Paper (local edition), perhaps millions of other reasons, perhaps 6.

No matter how things arrive, this repository of the leftovers of "normal" space accumulate here. Make of it what you will. Maybe don't touch stuff, or maybe do. It's kill or be killed. Well, those are two options, killing maybe doesn't have anything to do with it.

boardgame.name: Klöss
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Klöss is a cursed craftsman. He dwells in his workshop deep inside the cold plains of Kergüs where he crafts presents, gives them away and punishes those who dare steal them.
One cold winter night he refused to open his door to a beggar, he is now doomed to forever be generous.

This short module includes details on how to use Klöss as an encounter, as well as a the layout and info about his Worskhop, should the players dare try to explore it.

boardgame.name: Fujiyama
フジヤマクリエイト
boardgame.description:
Build Fujiyama through the seasons and fill it with wildlife !

Each player is trying to build the best Fujiyama
Through 9 rounds, players place tiles to match season set collection for points.
However, the tiles that each player places each round comes from both their left and right neighbor.

Upon receiving 2 tiles, the player will choose 1 to place and the other to give away the next round.
And if your neighbor uses your tile instead of the tile from his/her other neighbor, you will get a wildlife token from them for end game scoring.

So do you give them a nice tile to help them and yourself, or do you pass on a tile that they may not desire in hopes of limiting their options or maybe getting it back next round?

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Greater or Lesser Aquarium (大なり小なり水族館)
boardgame.description:
Build an Aquarium together while trying to satisfy the demands of the fishes

Players work together to build a 5x5 Aquarium grid while trying to ensure that the mathematical equations hold true on all connecting sides of the tile
Each animal tile states a number along with the < or > symbol on each side
Players take turns placing a tile from their hand trying to successfully build the 25 tile aquarium

boardgame.name: 18NewEngland 2: The Railroads of the Northern States
boardgame.description:
18NewEngland 2 is an alternate map for 18NewEngland. It was designed primarily as a 2-3 player game, but also accommodates 4 players. The play time should be about 2/3 as long as the base 18NewEngland game.

This expansion reuses the components from 18NewEngland except the board. Some trains and tiles are removed to fit the smaller map.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Tapestry: Meeple Realty Organizer
boardgame.description:
Tapestry of the Civilizations

Individual player trays to store all components needed for each player, allowing for faster setup.
Two identical trays for Territory tiles to allow for easy access to the tiles, especially for larger player counts.
Custom designed trays to store the landscapes with the optional colored bases. This allows for faster setup and setting up the trays where they are needed.
The game can be stored vertically.
Designed for faster setup, most trays can directly be used during game plays.

listing.notes: Organizer for the base game of Tapestry, and comes with 3 sets of extra dice as well

boardgame.name: Space Cat
boardgame.description:
Space Cat is a game of dexterity. You have to complete your part of Galaxy take cards from the space. To get a card you have to launch your rocket onto the right planet or right star. You can also attack your opponents and take a card from them.
The first who completes their board is the winner.

—user summary

boardgame.name: PicNic
boardgame.description:
It’s time for a picnic! Rabbits and foxes work together to find as many fruit and vegetables as they can, as quickly as they can. So that they don’t get lost, they decide to tie themselves together with a string. Which team will gather the most carrots, watermelons, apples and pineapples?

Your meeples, a fox and a rabbit, are tied-together and you have to move them to take fruit optimizing their movement. Each turn, a wheel will be spun and you have to move according your meeples that are tied together so have limited movements.

When three pineapples have been taken, the player with most fruit will be the winner.

boardgame.name: Around The World
boardgame.description:
Each players has to send six postcards from different cities to win. To move to each city, they can walk the streets or use boats, airplanes or trains.
It is very important to optimize the movement to win.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Floralia
boardgame.description: Each gardener will need a good memory and a strategy for flipping the pyramids in the right direction to find weather that is indicated on the current page of the books to help a flower to grow. First who has a complete beautiful flower will be the winner.

boardgame.name: A Matter of Fae
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Introduction: While exploring P6H-970, the team finds an apparently barren world. Upon returning to the Stargate, however, they find it isn’t as abandoned as it seemed, and the figure waiting for them may hold the fate of the Stargate Program in their hands.

A three-hour “episode” for level 1-4 characters of the Stargate SG-1 Roleplaying Game

boardgame.name: Field of Reeds
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Introduction: The Tok’ra need Phoenix Site’s help to rescue long-lost friends from an underground base on a world recently abandoned by the Goa’uld.

A three-hour “episode” for level 1-4 characters of the Stargate SG-1 Roleplaying Game

boardgame.name: Where Giants Tread
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Introduction: The Goa’uld Wepwawet is hunting for Phoenix Site. Your team has been tasked with planting a listening device on his Ha’tak mothership to find out what he knows, but even more interesting developments follow.

A three-hour “episode” for level 2-5 characters (optimized For APL 4) for the Stargate SG-1 Roleplaying Game

boardgame.name: Stargate Iconic Pregens
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A series of pre-generated characters, presented with full-color art, and intended for print-and-play use. Each character is presented in a four-page PDF file. The available characters are:


Iconic Diplomat Maste Levels 1-3
Iconic Engineer Bervell Levels 1-3
Iconic Scientist Lanni Levels 1-3
Iconic Scout Oringo Levels 1-3
Iconic Soldier A'tir Levels 1-3
Iconic Medic Kulera Levels 1-3
Iconic Soldier Rodriguez Levels 1-3

boardgame.name: It Consumes!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the Northern Wastes lies the mining settlement of Jhurn-Hokaz. It is the sole source of iron ore for the Southern Kingdoms. Recently deliveries have ceased and the Duke has charged your party to investigate the matter personally. You arrive only to find the town mysteriously empty! Shanties and shacks left to rot in the elements. Livestock frozen in the snow…or is it snow? Why then does it taste so sweet?

It Consumes is a 2nd level adventure for players with a stomach of steel! For, in the end, you’ll be questioning your allies and yourself…am I consuming it, or is it consuming me?
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Birthplace
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Introduction: Travel back to Reese’s homeworld to further explore what befell the colony and what the Replicators left behind.

A ninety-minute “episode” for level 1-4 characters of the Stargate SG-1 Roleplaying Game

boardgame.name: Ecology
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Introduction: “They’re like locusts on steroids; nothing on this planet can kill them. All these worlds linked together by the gate system, it’s a wonder this hasn’t happened before.”

A ninty-minute “episode” for level 1-4 characters of the Stargate SG-1 Roleplaying Game

boardgame.name: Mechanicus
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Introduction: “It’s a beacon, it predates the Stargate by several million years-- and we activated it.”

A ninety-minute “episode” for level 1-4 characters of the Stargate SG-1 Roleplaying Game

boardgame.name: Run
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Introduction: “I’d normally cheer when System Lords go to war with each other-- But I’m not normally on the planet where they’re duking it out”

A ninety-minute “episode” for level 1-4 characters of the Stargate SG-1 Roleplaying Game

boardgame.name: The Eyes of the Storm
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A ninety-minute Side Mission episode for level 1-4 characters for the Living RPG Series.
...
After a Goa’uld kidnaps innocent townsfolk, it’s up to the team to rescue them from almost certain death.

boardgame.name: Ride the Rails: The Netherlands
boardgame.description:
Ride the Rails: The Netherlands is an expansion for Ride the Rails that can also be used with the Winsome original Rail USA. The game is for 3-5 players, takes less an hour, with one page of expansion rules.
The game covers the entire nation on two 11x17 inch color maps. Among other elements, the player attaining the Maatschappij tot Exploitatie van Staatsspoorwegen receives a hefty bonus. The terrain in The Netherlands has no Mountains, but plenty of Impassible waterways.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Call to Adventure: Epic Origins – Heed the Call Promo Card
boardgame.description:
Promo Card for Call to Adventure: Epic Origins originally available as an Early Backer reward.

You may journey for free. If you gain a trait or attempted a challenge revealed this turn, gain 1 experience.

boardgame.name: Zookeepers: Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
Expand your "Zookeepers" game with these 10 new special species to save:

Card #1 - American flamingo
Card #2 - One-horned rhinoceros
Card #3 - Manchurian crane
Card #4 - Green aracari
Card #5 - Black-and-white ruffed lemur
Card #6 - Hyacinth macaw
Card #7 - Slender-tailed meerkat
Card #8 - Common Green Iguana
Card #9 - Common Bottlenose Dolphin
Card #10 - Frilled Lizard

boardgame.name: Describing Movies Badly
boardgame.description:
Are you naturally bad at describing movies? Don’t know actors names? No problem. Can’t remember the plot. No sweat!

Can you describe a movie badly enough where your team can guess the movie but bad enough where the other team has no clue what you’re talking about?

This is a funny game where you challenge your friends movie nerdiness by reading a bad description of a movie and they have to guess the movie from your bad description.

--For solo play--
Cover the name of the movie.
Guess the movie by the bad description only.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: For Science: 9'‘ Circular Lab Mats
boardgame.description: Use these exclusive neoprene Mats as a nice area to build your cures!

boardgame.name: Anno Domini 1666: Dragoon with Blunderbuss and Musketeer with Halberd
boardgame.description:
A set of special models that can be swapped into the factions in the core Anno Domini 1666 set. A Dragoon with a blunderbuss for the Defenders of the Crown and a King's Musketeer with a halberd for the Musketeers. These characters are considered 'unique' and replace one of the standard Musketeers or Dragoons when deploying a force.

This addition to Anno Domini 1666 was released as a limited promotion during the 2021 holiday season via the Wargamer Games Studio online shops. Both metal and plastic versions of the models were produced.

Contents:
2 miniatures (Dragoon with blunderbuss and King's Musketeer with halberd)
2 character cards
1 rule card
4 item cards

boardgame.name: Fey Compendium
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The fey have arguably had the least amount of material made for them over the course of D&D history. While fiends, dragons, the undead, and aberrations have all had
numerous sourcebooks detailing them, it wasn't until 4th edition that we finally received a sourcebook for the fey. In 3.5 there were less than 10 fey that broke the CR 15 mark, and that's including Dragon magazine and Dungeon magazine entries. The fey have never been given distinct classifications, such as the difference between true dragons and their lesser kin or the delineation between demons and devils. It wasn't until 4th edition that we even got statistics for unique fey lords, and those were confined to the pages of Dragon magazine and Dungeon magazine (excluding, of course, the statistics given in 2nd edition's Monster Mythology to detail the various fey gods). In short, the fey have always been more than a little ignored.

boardgame.name: Fey Compendium 2: Hags
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

All hags are dangerous and foul, and as they get older they get more wily, cunning, and cruel. A hag is well known in her locale, stories of her being told from generation to generation. However, some hags have lived so long and cultivated such notoriety that they have made names for themselves that extend beyond the bounds of their immediate territories.

boardgame.name: Fey Compendium 3
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A collection of horror themed fey to plague the dark forests, misty moors, and moonless nights of your world.

boardgame.name: Fey Compendium 4: Winter Fey
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A myriad of fey to populate the snowy forests, windswept fields, and dark nights of the coldest months of the year.

boardgame.name: Marvelous Heroes: Ultimate Edition
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Marvelous Heroes: Ultimate Edition is a digital supplement created for use with the Dungeons & Dragons 5th edition ruleset. It contains a collection of comic-book themed heroic archetypes, inspired by various cape crusaders throughout the golden age of comics and beyond.

Each archetype has been inspired by a particular super-heroine or hero, ranging from the easily recognizable to the exceptionally obscure, providing a mountain of content and asymmetric play-styles you can explore in your home games.

boardgame.name: Phoenix Site Base
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This product includes full-color pages that make up the Phoenix Site base meant for skirmish combat. There are 4 full floors of the base. Also included is a firefight map of the entire Phoenix Site and town of Haven.

User summary:

Intended for print-and-play use.

boardgame.name: Town of Haven
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This product includes full-color pages that make up the town of Haven meant for skirmish combat. There are 5 distinct districts, one for each race.

User summary:

Intended for print-and-play use.

boardgame.name: The Book of Beastlings
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A fey-touched lineage of anthropomorphic animals with over 130 ancestries.

boardgame.name: Nook: Le Racoon et les Ouassous
boardgame.description:
Nook and his friends enjoy fishing for crayfish under the Caribbean sun. Only Rainbo, the Lorikeet, disapproves of these frenzied fishing parties and will try to stop them.

Each player has cards representing a team of raccoon dogs with different strenghs, some lobsters and a parrot. Every turn, you select one card, hidden face. By bluffing the others and a little bit of luck, the player will have to select the correct one, to catch the lobsters of the other players (only the biggest raccoon of the trick wins) without being disturb by a parrot.

boardgame.name: Oui!: Le grand jeu de l'amour et du hasard
boardgame.description:
(Name meaning : "Yes ! The game and chance", inspired by a book of Marivaux)

This game is a quiz of 1340 questions about love. Movies, History, Literature, Songs... everything will be explored, and by any means : drawing, quiz, mimes, memory games...

The board consists of a heartshape track with spaces in three different colors, corresponding to different difficulties. Players roll a dice and move along the track. When a player stops on a color, he gets a question of the appropriate difficulty. A correct answer allows the player to roll again.

Once a player reach the middle of the board, he win the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: The Defeat of Medusa
メドゥーサの敗北
boardgame.description:
The Defeat of Medusa (メドゥーサの敗北) is a deduction game from Japan.

One player is the Medusa, who turns people to stone by her gaze. Another player is the Hero, sent to defeat the medusa. The remaining players are statues, previous victims of the Medusa, who know her weakness. The statues must convey this weakness to the Hero, before Medusa identifies it first.

The Statues know what the Medusa's vulnerability is, and they choose to freeze in poses in order to suggest what it is. The hero must try and work out what this is and declare it before the Medusa does. If so, the Hero and Statues win. But if the Medusa has also worked it out, the Hero and Statues lose.

Medusa's weakness could be a variety of things, and a deck of cards suggests the types of things it could be. For example, it might be 'a certain dish', 'a creature', 'a character', 'a certain occupation', 'a certain color'.
boardgame.boardgameartist: Yuki Nakamura (なかむら ゆき)

boardgame.name: Busy Busy Bake Shop
boardgame.description:
The Busy Busy Bake Shop is the most popular donut shop in town! They have all kinds of flavors you can mix and match. But lately there’s been a problem: a donut-loving mouse is sneaking off with some of the donuts! Can you stop the hungry mouse from swiping all the tasty donuts? Match up the different flavors of donuts to boost color and pattern matching skills, and practice counting as you calculate how many donuts you saved and how many treats the mouse snuck off with! Players work together using simple strategy and fine motor skills: if you can place 4 donuts in a row before the mouse runs off with 3 donuts, you win the game!

Develops fine-motor skills, cooperation, counting and color and pattern matching Ideal for home or classroom use.

—description from the publisher
